case_title: Dr. BASHIR AHMED KHAWAJA, LIVESTOCK OFFICER, FARM L.D.R.C. AMBORE, MUZAFFARABAD vs AZAD GOVERNMENT OF THE STATE OF JAMMU & KASHMIR through its Chief Secretary and 5 others
court: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal

appellant.name: Dr. Bashir Ahmed Khawaja
appellant.designation: Livestock Officer, Farm L.D.R.C. Ambore, Muzaffarabad

respondant.name: Azad Government of the State of Jammu & Kashmir

accussed_details.name: Respondent No. 5
allegation: Wrong inclusion in seniority list of Department of Extension, Research and Development

accussed_details.name: Respondent No. 6
allegation: Wrong inclusion in seniority list of Department of Extension, Research and Development

prosecution: Standing Counsel for Respondents No. 1 to 4

complaint_summary: The appellant challenged the validity of the seniority list dated 31.12.2004, claiming Respondents No. 5 and 6 were wrongly included in the Department of Extension, Research and Development instead of Animal Health Department. The appellant argued this inclusion infringed his rights.
investigation_summary: The appellant alleged that Respondents No. 5 and 6 were junior to him and their inclusion in the seniority list violated departmental rules. Respondents argued their inclusion was based on valid options exercised under departmental rules and that the appellant lacked locus standi.

findings: Respondent No. 5's inclusion in the seniority list was valid.
Appellant did not provide sufficient evidence to justify claims.
Appellant does not meet the criteria of an aggrieved person.
judgment_summary.decision: Appeal dismissed with no order as to costs.

legal_arguments: Appellant claimed Respondents No. 5 and 6 were not eligible for inclusion in the seniority list.
Respondent No. 5 argued his inclusion was based on valid options exercised under departmental rules.
Appellant failed to file replication or rebut written arguments of Respondents.
key_issues: Eligibility of Respondents No. 5 and 6 for inclusion in Department of Extension, Research and Development

appellant_claims: Respondents No. 5 and 6 were wrongly included in the Department of Extension, Research and Development.
Respondents No. 5 and 6 belong to the Animal Health Department.
Impugned seniority list infringed appellant's rights.
respondent_objections: Appellant is NPS B-17, while Respondent No. 5 is NPS B-18.
Appellant's objections to provisional seniority list were considered but rejected.
respondent_justifications: Respondent No. 5 opted for inclusion in Extension, Research and Development.
Educational qualification (DVM) is valid for both departments.
additional_notes: Respondent No. 6 passed away in 2005; appeal abetted to his extent.
Appellant did not file replication to respondent objections.
Appellant failed to demonstrate how he was aggrieved by the seniority list.

legal_terms.locus standi: The right or capacity to bring an action or to appear in a court.

words_and_phrases.seniority list: A list ranking employees based on their length of service or qualifications.

summary_vector_notes: The appellant challenged the inclusion of Respondents No. 5 and 6 in the seniority list of the Department of Extension, Research and Development, claiming it infringed his rights. The court found the appellant failed to substantiate his claims and dismissed the appeal.
